headline: Why Opendoor (OPEN) Stock Is Trading Up Today
summary: Shares of technology real estate company Opendoor (NASDAQ:OPEN) jumped 11.3% in the afternoon session after heightened interest from retail investors, fueled by social media activity and its status as a "meme stock."

headline: The battle for Pepsi’s future has begun
summary: PepsiCo is losing the soda wars to Coca-Cola. That’s nothing new. But after it fell into third place behind Dr Pepper, a heavyweight activist investor said Tuesday that the company needs a drastic shakeup.

headline: Elliott Sends Presentation to Board of Directors of PepsiCo Inc.
summary: Elliott Investment Management L.P. ("Elliott"), which manages funds that together hold an investment of $4 billion in PepsiCo (NASDAQ: PEP) (the "Company" or "PepsiCo"), today sent a presentation and letter to the Company's Board of Directors. The materials set out PepsiCo's unique opportunity to re-accelerate growth and boost financial performance through greater focus, improved operations, strategic reinvestment and enhanced accountability.

raw.headline: Elliott Sends Presentation to Board of Directors of PepsiCo Inc.

("Elliott"), which manages funds that together hold an investment of $4 billion in PepsiCo (NASDAQ: PEP) (the "Company" or "PepsiCo"), today sent a presentation and letter to the Company's Board of Directors. The materials set out PepsiCo's unique opportunity to re-accelerate growth and boost financial performance through greater focus, improved operations, strategic reinvestment and enhanced accountability.

headline: Elliott calls for turnaround at PepsiCo after building $4 billion stake
summary: (Reuters) -Elliott Management on Tuesday disclosed a $4 billion stake in PepsiCo and urged the beverage maker to revive its soda business, boost its share price and become more competitive.  PepsiCo's stock performance has lagged that of its biggest rival, Coca-Cola, over the past five years, as the Quaker Oats maker faces erratic demand in its snacks business and shifts its focus to healthier drinks and sodas.  Elliott's stake represents about 2% of PepsiCo's market value as of Friday close, making it one of the firm's biggest holdings.

raw.headline: Elliott calls for turnaround at PepsiCo after building $4 billion stake
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Elliott Management on Tuesday disclosed a $4 billion stake in PepsiCo and urged the beverage maker to revive its soda business, boost its share price and become more competitive.  PepsiCo's stock performance has lagged that of its biggest rival, Coca-Cola, over the past five years, as the Quaker Oats maker faces erratic demand in its snacks business and shifts its focus to healthier drinks and sodas.  Elliott's stake represents about 2% of PepsiCo's market value as of Friday close, making it one of the firm's biggest holdings.

headline: Elliott Plans Major Activist Campaign at PepsiCo With $4 Billion Stake
summary: Activist investor Elliott Investment Management has built a roughly $4 billion stake in  PepsiCo  and plans to push the beverage and snacks giant to make changes to boost its sagging share price, according to people familiar with the matter.  PepsiCo has been struggling to win back soda drinkers after ceding market share to rivals.  Its food business, once an engine of growth for the company, is also under pressure.

raw.headline: Elliott Plans Major Activist Campaign at PepsiCo With $4 Billion Stake
raw.summary: Activist investor Elliott Investment Management has built a roughly $4 billion stake in  PepsiCo  and plans to push the beverage and snacks giant to make changes to boost its sagging share price, according to people familiar with the matter.  PepsiCo has been struggling to win back soda drinkers after ceding market share to rivals.  Its food business, once an engine of growth for the company, is also under pressure.

headline: America Inc. Swaps Decades for Days in Rush to Commercial Paper
summary: Coca-Cola Co., PepsiCo Inc., Philip Morris International Inc. and Honeywell International Inc. have all tapped the market in recent months, selling billions worth of the short-term IOUs, which typically range in maturity from 30 to 90 days.  The renewed embrace of commercial paper is fueling the biggest expansion in the market since 2006, and underscores just how dramatically corporate America has been shifting its funding mix.  Faced with elevated interest rates and tariff turmoil, companies have moved to shore up cash buffers while avoiding locking in higher long-term borrowing costs, especially with potential Federal Reserve rate cuts on the horizon.

headline: The Beverage Forum Europe Unveils Star Roster
summary: The Beverage Forum Europe, the highly anticipated transatlantic expansion of the leading U.S. beverage industry gathering, today announced a formidable roster of confirmed attendees and speakers for its inaugural event at Indigo at The O2 in London, 7 - 8 October, 2025.
